data.title: Great 'za!
data.text: Service here is excellent.  So is the delivery...bit I live close by. Really nice people, above average pizza.

data.title: Decent food
data.text: We stayed in a hotel close by and decided to give this place a try.  If you are wanting to sit in a restaurant to eat this is not the place for you.  They only have a few seats so you can wait for your food so you have to pick up or get delivery.  We ordered ribs, pizza, spaghetti and a burger.  Everything was pretty good.  My only complaint is that I wanted my burger to just have the burger, cheese and bacon and we thought that is how we ordered it through the online ordering but it came with everything on it.  Not sure if it was our fault or theirs but I took off what I could and ate the burger anyway and it was good so that says a lot. ;)  I would go here again if I was in the area.

data.title: Don't even waste your time!
data.text: I traveled from out of town and was given menus from the front desk at my hotel. This place looked like they had a pretty good menu, so I ordered from them and placed over $100 order for the 8 people in my family. I ordered a salad with grilled chicken, and was told they have no grilled chicken but they could make me the salad.  Then I ordered fried chicken and ribs and was told that they had no chicken breasts but they were currently "waiting" for a delivery. (At 5:30 pm? A delivery?) Not to mention it would be 2 hours after they would be able to deliver my food. It would be unfair for me to rate the food, as I never even got to sample any. I canceled my order and went to Lou Malnati's.

data.title: Average pizza house
data.text: Average pizza house, slow delivery and not Chicago style pizza.  Cheap and good slices.  There is better pizza from commerical places....

data.title: Great pizza
data.text:
Arrived just after 4 pm to pick up a meat lover's pizza. The pizza was ready when promised. Staff was friendly and laid back.

Some pizzas are good when you first eat them, but then lose their tastiness when reheated the next day. Not Mug's. The pizza was just as good the next day and day after that.

The only negative (not Mug's fault) was the sales tax. 12%!!! No excuse for that.

I will definitely return here when I am back in town. Two thumbs up.

data.title: Best thin crust pizza in town
data.text: Ever since Barnaby's went out of business, we have searched for a thin crust closest to Barnaby's. We tried many over the last couple of years. About 6 months ago, we tried Mugs and loved it. Ever since then, we've had many pizzas from Mugs and trul rnjoy it.

data.title: First class ribs
data.text: Really good ribs, great chips, friendly service, be prepared for a wait at busy times, it was an hour for collections and 2 for deliveries on a Friday night, worth the wait though.

data.title: Fabulous pizza
data.text: This review is based on one picked-up pizza.  It was out of this world.  We had the medium sausage pizza, which would have been enough for at least four hungry people.  It was loaded with lots of ooey gooey cheese--the kind that strings when you tug on a piece-you know what I mean.  The sausage was ample and very well seasoned.  The sauce was yummy too.  We needed it fast because we had somewhere to be, and the pizza maker was happy to accommodate us.  All around great experience, and we will be back!  Not really a dine-in place.

data.title: Quick and Easy and Good!
data.text: Mug's is our go-to place when we just can't decide (or agree) on what's for dinner. You can pick up or have them deliver. The pizza is really good and the sauce is excellent. They are generous with toppings and there is always a coupon to be found.
